Many consumers treat a common skin ailment with a skin cream. A skin doctor plans to conduct a study to investigate the following claim made in a recent report. For people with a common skin ailment, there is a difference between the proportion cured by using Skin Cream X and the proportion cured by using Skin Cream Y. The doctor will randomly assign <math alttext="300" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers with the skin ailment to use one of two skin creams, with <math alttext="150" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> assigned to use Skin Cream X each day and the remaining <math alttext="150" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> assigned to use Skin Cream Y each day. The doctor will record the number of people cured after six months for each skin cream. (a) Describe the benefit of randomly assigning the type of skin cream to the volunteers.

(b) Describe a process that can be used to randomly assign the <math alttext="300" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers to the two skin creams.

The results from the study are shown in the following segmented bar graph. (c) For the <math alttext="300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers in the study, is there support for the report’s claim? Justify your answer using values from the segmented bar graph. Do not perform an inferential procedure.

The doctor conducted a hypothesis test to investigate the report’s claim. Let <math alttext="p sub X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> be the proportion of people similar to those in the study who would be cured with Skin Cream X, and let <math alttext="p sub Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> be the proportion of people similar to those in the study who would be cured with Skin Cream Y. The hypotheses of the test are: <math alttext="H sub 0: p sub X equals p sub Y. (e) Based on the hypothesis test and resulting <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of <math alttext="0.223" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.223</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, what can the doctor conclude about the report’s claim?
